author: potuz
content: I just realized that my old "compounding validators" PR can be easily changed by allowing withdrawals to BLS addresses and BLS changes to BLS addresses

author: jgm
content: How would it know which address to withdraw to?  Wouldn't there have to be a field added to the validator to hold this?

author: jgm
content: Sure, but what would the equivalent of the `0x01` credentials be for another entity on the beacon chain?  The field isn't big enough to hold a full BLS public key.  Would you use a validator index, for example?

author: potuz
content: Nah, you could just do a BLS change to a full BLS pubkey. The length of the field is good enough to differentiate the type

author: jgm
content: Curious as to how that would work, given you only have 32 bytes to play with even if you steal the type identifier (which you could, given that compressed BLS public keys have a usefully high lower bound for their upper byte).

author: potuz
content: Oh I now see what you mean, you ask how do you overwrite the withrawal credentials? Sure it's simply 0x02000... And finish with the validator index in the last 8 bytes

author: jgm
content:
